title: linux-sandbox didn't config /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ping_group_range, leads IPPROTO_ICMP not usable inside network namespace

labels.name: team-Local-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Local) team

body:
### Description of the bug:


I found my code which create socket with IPPROTO_ICMP 
```C
#include <netinet/in.h>
#include <stdio.h>
#include <sys/socket.h>
int main() {
  const int sock_fd = socket(AF_INET, SOCK_DGRAM, IPPROTO_ICMP);

  if (sock_fd == -1) {
    perror("create socket");
    return 1;
  } else {
    printf("success");
    return 0;
  }
}
```
can't run under linux-sandbox, without tags requires-network.
 if test has no requires-network tag, linux-sandbox will create network namespace,
but sys config /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ping_group_range which controls the usability of IPPROTO_ICMP,
will be reset to default "forbidden all" value (see https://forums.opensuse.org/t/network-namespace-does-not-work-for-non-root-user/143817/2 and https://lwn.net/Articles/422330/). so after enter linux-sandbox,
testcase won't be able to use IPPROTO_ICMP to create socket.
this can be resolved when fakeroot is used and write valid gid "0 0 " to /proc/sys/net/ipv4/ping_group_range.
podman also have similar process https://github.com/containers/common/blob/f34973f3d54cf4e7c7e14dac36f32fb6d46d9dd6/pkg/config/containers.conf#L66-L68
I have a branch , https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/compare/master...comicfans:bazel:make_ping_work shall I create a PR for this? 


### Which category does this issue belong to?

_No response_

### What's the simplest, easiest way to reproduce this bug? Please provide a minimal example if possible.


create a testcase shown in description , don't tag it with requires-network, then it will fail under linux-sandbox

### Which operating system are you running Bazel on?


linux

I'm testing on master dacb794
